ObjectsReferences
ObjectsReferences

The purpose of this class is to track references between each GUI Objects.  So when cloning happens, the cloned version of the GUI Objects will be referenced (if present) instead of the original GUI Objects.

      A            A-copy
      │            │
      ├─►B         ├─►B-copy
      │            │
      ├─►C         ├─►C-copy
      │            │
      └─►D         └─►D-copy

If B has a references to C and D.
Then B-copy will be referencing C-copy and D-copy instead
of C and D.

If a GUI Object (Referencer) references another GUI Object (Referencee), then the GUI Object it is referencing (Referencee) will be stored in this class inside the GUI Object (Referencer)

Additionally, the GUI Object that is referencing the other object (Referencer) will be stored in ExternalObjectsDependencies in the GUI Object which is being referenced (Referencee).

This is do so to prevent invalid referencing when one of the referencing GUI Objects is deleted.  In other words, this is a 2-way referencing system.

You normally don't need to deal with this

Functions
GetObjectsReferencesCount
virtual int GetObjectsReferencesCount() const

Returns the number of GUI Object this is referencing

AddObjectReference
virtual ssGUIObjectIndex AddObjectReference(
ssGUI::GUIObject* obj
)

Adds the GUI Object to the referencing table. Returns the index of it.

GetObjectReference
virtual ssGUI::GUIObject* GetObjectReference(
ssGUIObjectIndex index
) const

Gets the referencing GUI Object of the referencing index. Nullptr is returned if invalid index.

virtual void SetObjectReference(
ssGUIObjectIndex index,
ssGUI::GUIObject* obj
)

Sets the referencing GUI Object with the index

RemoveObjectReference
virtual void RemoveObjectReference(
ssGUIObjectIndex index,
bool internalCleanUp = false
)

Removes the referencing GUI Object with the index

AddExternalDependency
virtual void AddExternalDependency(
ObjectsReferences* dependency,
ssGUIObjectIndex index
)

Adds the external depending ObjectsReferences

RemoveExternalDependency
virtual void RemoveExternalDependency(
ObjectsReferences* dependency
)

Removes the external depending ObjectsReferences

GetObjectIndex
virtual ssGUIObjectIndex GetObjectIndex(
ssGUI::GUIObject* obj
) const

Gets the referencing index by the address of the GUI Object. Returns -1 if not found

IsObjectReferenceExist
virtual bool IsObjectReferenceExist(
ssGUI::GUIObject* obj
) const

Returns true if the GUI Object is being referenced

GetListOfObjectsIndices

Gets all the valid referencing index

CleanUp
virtual void CleanUp()

Removes all references to this object

Debug function to make sure all the references are valid
